articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants in 8th KCU Congress
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants in 8th KCU Congress
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Respected Marshal Kim Jong Un had a photo session with the participants in the 8th Congress of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 When Kim Jong Un appeared at the venue of the photo session, KCU delegates presented a fragrant bouquet to him and put a red tie around his neck.
					
					 The 8th Congress of the KCU was an important occasion for further developing it into eternally glorious children's union of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he said, and warmly congratulated the participants in the congress who displayed over the world the spirit of three million KCU members fully preparing themselves to be reliable reserves for building a socialist power and true successors to the youth league by steadfastly carrying forward the traditions of the anti-Japanese children's corps and the lineage of Paektu.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the participants in the congress would bring about a new revolutionary turn in the KCU work and strengthen it into the rank of future heroes of the powerful Paektusan nation, being always ready for socialist Korea, he had a photo session with them.
					
					 Present at the photo session were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK; Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., WPK; and Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of sympathy to Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, as regards the twin simultaneous terrorist armed attacks in Tehran that killed or wounded dozens of people.
					 In the message Kim expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the Iranian president and through him to the victims and bereaved families.
					
					 Resolutely condemning the terrorist attacks, the message expressed the will to further strengthen cooperation between the two countries in the struggle to oppose all forms of terrorism and ensure world peace and stability and wished the Iranian government successes in the efforts to ensure socio-political security of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Nepalese PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Nepalese PM
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Sher Bahadur Deuba on his appointment as prime minister of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal.
					 Expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries with long history and traditions would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the prime minister successes in his work.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to UN Secretary General
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to UN Secretary General
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Antonio Guterres, secretary general of the United Nations, Thursday over the death of Babatunde Osotimehin, executive director of the UN Population Fund.
					 Ri in the message expressed deep condolence to the secretary general, and through him, to the bereaved family.

articles.title: FM Spokesman of DPRK Flays Tillerson's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
FM Spokesman of DPRK Flays Tillerson's Reckless Remarks
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to question raised by KCNA on June 8 as regards the fact that the U.S. state secretary again made impetuous remarks inciting the atmosphere of sanctions and pressure on the DPRK:
					 At a joint press conference held on June 6, during his visit to New Zealand, the U.S. state secretary Tillerson blustered that they have called on all nations to join them in putting pressure on the DPRK to cause it to rethink its strategy with the development of the nuclear weapons program.
					
					 His rash remark is no more than a desperate attempt to appease the increasing internal and external criticism of the U.S. policy towards the DPRK and resort to international pressure on it.
					
					 It is really pathetic to see the supposedly top diplomat of the U.S. prattling about the already worn-out sanctions and pressure in utter ignorance of the DPRK and without even a basic sense of reality.
					
					 The high-ranking officials of the U.S. would never stop touting for the so-called "toughest sanctions and pressure on the north" over and again in the forlorn hope of bringing the DPRK down, but their reckless and imprudent acts would only bring devastation and humiliation to the U.S.
					
					 The time when the U.S. used to unilaterally impose its will on other countries through arbitrary and high-handed practices has gone for good and the U.S.-style bravado that picks and bullies only the weak countries can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should clearly understand that its military threats and all the fuss about sanctions and pressure are only serving as the momentum that pushes the DPRK further into developing the nuclear force.
					
					 The DPRK will vigorously speed up and intensify the development and diversification of its nuclear force until the U.S. and its followers come to their senses and make a right choice.

articles.title: Japan Urged Not to Play Gamble on Its Destiny
articles.content:
Japan Urged Not to Play Gamble on Its Destiny
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea made public a statement Wednesday to denounce the Abe group who is viciously slandering the DPRK's steps of bolstering its military capability for self-defence while taking the lead in following the U.S. moves to impose sanctions and pressure on the DPRK.
					 Prime Minister Abe, Chief Cabinet Secretary Suga, Defense Minister Inada and other heavyweights of Japan vied with each other to attend official and unofficial meetings such as G-7 summit and "Asia Security Conference" and vociferate about "nuclear threat from north Korea" and "grave challenge", the statement noted, and said:
					
					 Japan would easily estimate whom the DPRK nuclear force buildup is aiming at. However, it is obtrusively making a great fuss over it. This can not be construed otherwise than scream by a thief being frightened even by the rustles in the brush.
					
					 Whenever the DPRK launched ballistic missiles, Japan had vociferated about "security uneasiness". Lurking behind it is a cunning and sinister purpose to revive militarism and realize the ambition for reinvasion of Asia by putting spurs to turning Japan into a military giant under the pretext of "nuclear threat from north Korea".
					
					 That's why Japan openly claims that the strong and enduring U.S.-Japan alliance is now playing the role for regional security, beyond the defense of its territory.
					
					 If Japan is concerned about its security, it should not act a poodle of the U.S. but withdraw its hostile policy toward the DPRK and remove the U.S. military bases for aggression from its territory.
					
					 It should be mindful that its archipelago may be reduced into ashes before the U.S. in case of contingency, if it behaves wickedly under the eyes of the DPRK as now.
					
					 Japan is the sworn enemy of the Korean people as it committed thrice-cursed crimes against them and left unhealed wounds.
					
					 Japan, an island country, should not play a dangerous gamble on its destiny before the merciless and invincible nuclear force of the DPRK.

articles.title: CCNR Spokesman Slams S. Korean Authorities for Joining in Outsiders' Anti-DPRK Moves
articles.content:
CCNR Spokesman Slams S. Korean Authorities for Joining in Outsiders' Anti-DPRK Moves
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Consultative Council for National Reconciliation Thursday gave an answer to question put by KCNA over the fact that the south Korean authorities supported the "sanctions resolution" cooked up at the UNSC.
					 The spokesman said:
					
					 Recently the U.S. and other hostile forces at the UNSC cooked up "sanctions resolution" 2356 against the DPRK over its test-fires of new-type ground-to-ground intermediate-range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 and ground-to-ground intermediate-range strategic ballistic missile Pukguksong-2.
					
					 This is no more than a brutal political terrorism against a sovereign state and it is no more than last-ditch effort of the U.S. and its vassal forces taken aback by the might of the DPRK.
					
					 But the south Korean authorities are now behaving imprudently, expressing support for such outrageous "resolution", the spokesman pointed out, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities let a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry and the like claim that they "appreciate the UNSC resolution as reconfirmation of the international community's firm will for the denuclearization of the north" and that they will make "sustained efforts for the north's denuclearization" by use of all possible means such as sanctions and pressure, joining the international community in faithfully fulfilling the "resolution".
					
					 It is needless to say that such disgraceful behavior is an unpardonable treachery of joining in the U.S. and other hostile forces' desperate moves to bar the DPRK from bolstering up its nuclear force and stifle it.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities want the improvement of the north-south relations and peace of the Korean peninsula, they should not join the outsiders in the anti-DPRK moves blindly, calling for "sanctions," but come out to display the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Slashes UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution"
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Slashes UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution"
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK declared the following principled stand on the recent UNSC's "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK at the plenary meeting of the second-round of the Geneva Disarmament Conference on June 6:
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces high-handedly adopted the "resolution" over the DPRK's ballistic rocket launch for bolstering up its nuclear force.
					
					 This is a heinous hostile act to bar the DPRK from bolstering up the nuclear force, disarm and smother it economically.
					
					 The DPRK strongly censures and categorically rejects it.
					
					 The UNSC dares to pull up the DPRK's legitimate measure for self-defence while keeping mum about the nuclear and missile tests of some countries including permanent members of the Security Council. This is a shameless arrogance and self-importance and the height of double standards.
					
					 The fact that the U.S. and China willfully cooked up and rammed the "resolution" through and impose it upon the members of the UN by painting it as "general will of the international community" is a vivid expression of high-handed and arbitrary practices.
					
					 The DPRK will steadily bolster up the nuclear force for self-defence till the U.S. and its vassal forces make a right choice, aware of the cause of the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula and its solution.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for New York
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for New York
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Ri Hung Sik, ambassador of the Foreign Ministry, left here Thursday to take part in the 10th Session of the Conference of State Parties to the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities to be held in New York of the U.S.

articles.title: Members of WFP Mission Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Members of WFP Mission Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Acting Representative Sven Thelin and staff members of the World Food Programme mission here did assistance work at the Sambong Co-op Farm in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on Thursday.
					 They helped farmers in rice-transplanting.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition-2017 Closes
articles.content:
Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition-2017 Closes
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The National Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition-2017 closed with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex on Thursday. It was opened to mark the 71st anniversary of the founding of the Korean Children's Union.
					 About 130 literary works and exhibits were highly appreciated at the exhibition.
					
					 Pyongyang City took the first place in team standing.

articles.title: Performance of Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Performance of Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- "Red Tie Fluttering under the Sun", a performance of schoolchildren celebrating the 71st anniversary of the Korean Children's Union, took place at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Wednesday and Thursday.
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., the youth league, and the participants in the 8th KCU Congress.
					
					 The performance was given by children of the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, the Kang Pan Sok Revolutionary School and the Pyongyang Primary School for Orphans, art group members of Mangyongdae and Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palaces and participants in the national schoolchildren art festival.
					
					 The performance began with prologue "June 6 Is Our Holiday, Holiday of All the People". Its numbers included chorus "The Generalissimo Is Our Sun", poem and dance "Young Revengers".
					
					 The performers sang loudly of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's warm love for posterity.
					
					 And there were such numbers as female chorus "The Marshal's Bright Smile" and male chorus "Our Marshal Is Best" that well represent the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un's loving care for children.
					
					 There were also numbers reflecting the resolution of younger generations to become true juvenile revolutionaries and children's guard shouldering the future of prosperous Korea.

articles.title: Participants in 8th KCU Congress Watch Documentary Film
articles.content:
Participants in 8th KCU Congress Watch Documentary Film
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 8th Congress of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) watched a documentary film "We Are the Happiest in the World" at the April 25 House of Culture on Thursday.
					 The film shows the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who have trained the rising generations to be revolutionary talents shouldering the future of prosperous Korea.
					
					 It deals with the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Un who strengthened the KCU into the eternal children's union of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, let the founding anniversary of the union be significantly celebrated in the new century and gave the glory and happiness to the KCU members.
					
					 Among the audience was Choe Ryong Hae and officials concerned.

articles.title: New Novels Published in DPRK
articles.content:
New Novels Published in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Art and Literature Publishing House in the DPRK recently published new novels.
					 Among them is full-length novel "Eternal Soul", part of the serial "Immortal Guidance", which deals with the immortal revolutionary exploits performed by leader Kim Jong Il in wisely leading the Movement for Winning the Title of O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment after initiating it.
					
					 The novel gives philosophical explanation of the key to the invincibility of the Korean People's Army through characters, showing well the blood ties established between Kim Jong Il, the Songun brilliant commander, and servicepersons.
					
					 Edited in the collection of short stories "Dawn" are over 10 short stories about the loving care for people shown by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un. "Clear Sky", "Shortcut", "Promise", "Dream in Bloom", "Our Blessed Sun", "Sunny House" and other short stories give a vivid ideological and artistic description of his noble traits and leadership exploits.
					
					 The book "Anecdotage of Master Kim Nicknamed Phoenix" (Vol.3) carries at least 20 satirical anecdotes.

articles.title: Kayagum-making Method Registered as National Intangible Heritage
articles.content:
Kayagum-making Method Registered as National Intangible Heritage
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The method of making kayagum (stringed Korean harp) was recently registered as one of national intangible heritages in the DPRK.
					 Kayagum, rectangular wooden string instrument, was invented by Uruk, a musician of Kaya (an old kingdom that existed in Korea from the mid-1st century B.C. to the mid-6th century A.D.), in the early years of the 6th century.
					
					 It consists of a sound box, silk strings, tuning pegs, leg, sound hole, etc.
					
					 Its soundboards are mainly made with paulownia, chestnut, black walnut and jujube trees that have grown for over 30 years.
					
					 Originally it had twelve strings, but it has been improved to be the present twenty-one-stringed instrument with a great compass.
					
					 Kayagum is used for mixed orchestra, accompaniment, solo, etc. for its dynamic sound, soft and elegant resonance and diverse executions.

articles.title: U.S. Should Face up to Strategic Position of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Should Face up to Strategic Position of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- If the U.S. persists in dead-end military standoff with the DPRK, failing to face up to its strategic position as an advanced nuclear power, it will meet the miserable end only, warns Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a commentary.
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Such American gangster logic that a country which surrenders after dropping nukes can exist but should never be pardoned if it advocates independence with nukes can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 No force on the earth can match the tremendous might of the invincible revolutionary Paektusan army which proved in practice that it is capable of defending the country from the enemy invasion on the ground, at seas and in the air and making a high-precision pinpoint nuclear strike on any individual target.
					
					 The DPRK is neither surprised nor frightened although the U.S. flexes its muscle by massively mobilizing its threat-representative strategic assets including nuclear carriers.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists make a provocation by counting on them, the DPRK will reduce them to scrap iron in a flash.
					
					 The U.S. pride that it hadn't got even a single shell fired at its territory though it trifled with the sovereignty and destiny of other countries and nations through numerous invasions and war provocations has now become an old story. The U.S. should always suffer from the distress that its mainland might be engulfed in flames due to the nuclear strikes of justice by the DPRK.
					
					 Time, justice and final victory are in store for the DPRK.

articles.title: USS Cheyenne Enters Pusan Port of S. Korea
articles.content:
USS Cheyenne Enters Pusan Port of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. nuclear-powered submarine Cheyenne entered the Pusan Port of south Korea Tuesday, according to KBS.
					 The sub, equipped with Tomahawk cruise missiles, will be reportedly involved in the joint drill with the south Korean puppet navy for a preemptive attack on the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean People Oppose THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean People Oppose THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Actions against THAAD deployment were reportedly staged all at once in Seoul and Songju of North Kyongsang Province of south Korea on June 3.
					 The Action for Checking THAAD Deployment held a protest rally in front of the Posin Pavilion in Seoul.
					
					 Speakers at the rally denounced the puppet Defense Ministry for intentionally hiding the fact about the additional introduction of THAAD launching pads.
					
					 The ralliers demanded that the U.S. withdraw THAAD from south Korea at once.
					
					 Earlier, children and youths in Kimchon City of North Kyongsang Province conducted an action against THAAD deployment, together with their mothers.
					
					 The Students' Council for Democracy and Independent Reunification held a meeting around Chongwadae in demand of the withdrawal of THAAD.

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Demand Withdrawal of THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Demand Withdrawal of THAAD
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Christian Churches held a prayer meeting for peace in Songju County, North Kyongsang Province on June 5, demanding repeal of THAAD deployment, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The organization urged the present regime to immediately withdraw THAAD and punish at once Han Min Gu for "breaching state discipline".

articles.title: S. Korean Body Calls for Joint Event Marking June 15
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Calls for Joint Event Marking June 15
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The South Kyongsang provincial headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration held a rally in Jinju City of the province on June 4, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Oh My News.
					 At the rally the representative of the headquarters called for holding a south-north joint event marking June 15 without fail.
					
					 The chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification said that now is just the time for achieving national reunification, calling on the public to greet the day of reunification with new hope, resolution, courage and determination.

articles.title: Meeting of Chongryon Central Committee Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Chongryon Central Committee Held
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The fourth session of the 23rd Central Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) was held at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on June 3.
					 Present there were Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen Nam Sung U and Pae Ik Ju of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and others.
					
					 Discussed at the meeting was the agenda item "On developing the movement of Koreans in Japan onto higher stage in conformity with the new era of Juche cause".
					
					 Ho Jong Man made a report of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee. 
					
					 The reporter mentioned the achievements made by Chongryon in one year after the enlarged meeting of the third session of the 23rd Chongryon Central Committee.
					
					 Referring to the main thrusts to be made by all organizations of Chongryon in the 100 day movement, he said: A vigorous work is being conducted to more thoroughly establish the ideological system and leadership of Juche at all its units from the Central Standing Committee to branches, consolidate the chapters and branches and grass-roots level organizations, open clear-cut vistas for a turn in the national education, give substantial help to the living of compatriots and join in the nationwide movement for improved north-south relations and pan-national conference to bring earlier national reunification.
					
					 He stressed the need to adorn 2017 as a year of victory and significantly greet the 24th Congress of Chongryon, to be a new landmark in the movement of Koreans in Japan next year, through a great innovation drive for boosting the overall work of Chongryon in keeping step with the people in the homeland under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Speeches were made at the session.
					
					 The speakers renewed their resolution to make this year a year of turn and lay foundations for opening a new heyday through sustained innovative movement for the 24th Congress of Chongryon.
					
					 The session adopted the report of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee as a decision of the Chongryon Central Committee.
					
					 It also dealt with organizational matters.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the session.

articles.title: Greatness of Kim Jong Un Praised in Nigeria
articles.content:
Greatness of Kim Jong Un Praised in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its internet homepage articles praising the greatness of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un on May 25 and June 1.
					 An article titled "Charm of Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un" said:
					
					 Charm of Supreme Leader of the DPRK Kim Jong Un, praised as the youngest and most attractive leader in our planet, is love and devotion to the people, in a word.
					
					 It is the common feelings of Koreans that they are attracted by his beaming smile and words.
					
					 People's mindset represents the will of Heaven. Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un held by the people in high esteem is the most prominent leader in the world.
					
					 From his appearance the world witnesses the ever-growing strength of justice smashing injustice without any vacillation despite harsh ordeals and difficulties of history.
					
					 Reverence and trust in him is spreading all over the world beyond Korea.
					
					 The world's enthusiastic sympathy and admiration for the excellent politics and excellent leader are growing stronger with passage of time.
					
					 Another article titled "Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's Outlook on Posterity" praised his politics of love for the future, stressing that immensely rosy is the future of socialist Korea advancing under the slogan "Love the future!"

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia junto a delegados al VIII Congreso de la ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia junto a delegados al VIII Congreso de la ONC
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un se fotografio junto a los delegados al VIII Congreso de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					Cuando el Mariscal salio al lugar de filmacion, los delegados infantiles le dieron un ramo de flores y le pusieron la panoleta roja.
					
					El Mariscal dijo que el presente conclave sirve de una oportunidad importante para consolidar mas la ONC como agrupacion infantil de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y felicito fervientemente a los delegados quienes mostraron a todo el mundo el impetu de 3 millones de miembros de la ONC que se preparan como fidedignas reservas de la construccion de la potencia socialista y verdaderos relevos de la Union de la Juventud, continuando firmemente la tradicion del Cuerpo Infantil antijapones y el linaje del monte Paektu.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los participantes en el Congreso produciran un nuevo viraje revolucionario en las labores de la ONC y consolidaran mas esta organizacion infantil como fila de los protagonistas futuros de la potencia Paektusan que se preparan siempre para la Corea socialista, y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					En la filmacion tomaron parte Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del CC del PTC, Ri Il Hwan, jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Jon Yong Nam, primer secretario del CC de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista.

articles.title: CNCDP advierte a Japon a actuar con prudencia
articles.content:
CNCDP advierte a Japon a actuar con prudencia
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que en estos ultimos dias, los compinches de Abe de Japon actuan aviesamente sumandose a las campanas de sancion y presion anti-RPDC de los Estados Unidos, al cuestionar las medidas tomadas por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea para fortalecer el poderio de autodefensa, el vocero del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) hizo publica el dia 7 una declaracion que senala:
					En las escenas oficiales y extraoficiales como la Cumbre de G-7 y la "conferencia de seguridad de Asia" el premier Abe, el director del secretariado del gabinete Suga, el ministro de Defensa Inada y otras autoridades de Japon repiten los mismos guiones conflictivos anti-RPDC hablando de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte" y el "desafio serio".
					
					Este acto del pais isleno que sabe bien a quien estan apuntando nuestras medidas de fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares, no es nada mas que un alarido de incendiario que grita primero "!fuego!".
					
					Cada vez que se lanzaban los cohetes balisticos de la RPDC, Japon arma alborotos de la "inquietud de seguridad", lo cual persigue el objeto de satisfacer su mal ambicion de realizar el resurgimiento militarista y la reagresion a Asia dando acicate a la conversion de su pais en potencia militar bajo el pretexto de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea".
					
					Lo demuestra el hecho de que Japon dice abiertamente que la fuerte y constante alianza EE.UU.-Japon cumple el papel de defender no solo a Japon, sino tambien a la seguridad de la region.
					
					Si Japon esta preocupado tanto por su seguridad, debe abandonar la politica hostil a la RPDC y expulsar de su territorio isleno las agresivas bases militares norteamericanas, en vez de actuar como perro mimado del pais norteamericano.
					
					Japon debe saber correctamente que en caso de seguir actuando como ahora el archipielago japones podria ser eliminado completamente antes que el pais norteamericano en el tiempo de emergencia.
					
					Japon es el enemigo jurado que cometio crimenes inauditos contra el pueblo coreano y le dejo a este las heridas nunca curables.
					
					El no debe hacer un juego peligroso con su destino ante las invencibles fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC que no saben la piedad.

articles.title: Portavoz del CRN advierte a autoridades surcoreanas que se adhieren a fuerzas foraneas
articles.content:
Portavoz del CRN advierte a autoridades surcoreanas que se adhieren a fuerzas foraneas
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada por un reportero de la ACNC con respecto a que las autoridades surcoreanas exponen su apoyo a la "resolucion de sancion" contra la RPDC, adoptada en el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional dio el dia 8 la respuesta siguiente: 
					Recientemente, Estados Unidos y otras fuerzas hostiles  adoptaron en el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU la "resolucion de sancion" anti-RPDC No. 2356 que cuestiona los lanzamientos de prueba de los cohetes estrategicos de mediano y largo alcance "Hwasong-12" y "Pukguksong-2" de la RPDC.
					
					Esto deviene un terrorismo politico contra un pais soberano y no pasa de ser un retorcimiento desesperado del pais norteamericano y las fuerzas seguidoras, muy estupefactos ante el cada dia mas creciente poderio nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, las autoridades surcoreanas actuan ahora de manera irrazonable expresando a ciegas un apoyo a esa malsana "resolucion".
					
					Esta vez, las autoridades surcoreanas dijeron por conducto del portavoz de la cancilleria y otros tipejos que "evaluan la resolucion del CS de la ONU como una reafirmacion nueva de la voluntad dura de la sociedad internacional por la desnuclearizacion del Norte" y que "haran esfuerzos sostenibles por lograr este objeto" observando con fidelidad la "resolucion" de la ONU junto con la sociedad internacional y valiendose de todos los medios como la sancion y presion.
					
					No cabe duda de que esta actitud absurda constituye un imperdonable acto antinacional que se adhiere a las maniobras desesperadas de EE.UU. y las fuerzas hostiles destinadas a detener el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC y a asfixiarla.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas desean el mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, deben abandonar tales actos absurdos y volverse al espiritu: "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".

articles.title: Delegacion coreana parte de Pyongyang para participar en reunion internacional

Delegacion coreana parte de Pyongyang para participar en reunion internacional
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por Ri Hung Sik, embajador del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, partio el dia 8 de esta capital para participar en la 10a reunion de los paises interesados en el convenio sobre los derechos de los discapacitados a efectuarse en Nueva York de los Estados Unidos.
